Package com.github.tommyettinger.cringe

Class PointSequence.R3

java.lang.Object
com.github.tommyettinger.cringe.PointSequence<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3>
com.github.tommyettinger.cringe.PointSequence.R3
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json.Serializable, Externalizable, Serializable, Iterable<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3>, Iterator<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3>
Enclosing class:
PointSequence<V extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<V>>
public static class PointSequence.R3 extends PointSequence<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3>
A very simple Iterator or Iterable over Vector3 items, this produces Vector3 points that won't overlap or be especially close to each other for a long time by using the R3 Sequence. This uses a slight variant credited to Pascal Gilcher's article. If constructed with no arguments, this gets random initial offsets from MathUtils.random. You can specify the offsets yourself, and if you want to resume the sequence, you only need the last Vector3 produced, and can call resume(Vector3) with it. All Vector3 items this produces will be (and generally, those it is given should be) in the 0.0 (inclusive) to 1.0 (exclusive) range. This allocates a new Vector3 every time you call next(). You can also use nextInto(Vector3) to fill an existing Vector3 with what would otherwise be allocated by next().
This can be serialized out-of-the-box with libGDX Json or Apache Fury, as well as anything else that understands the Externalizable interface.
See Also:

      public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3 nextInto(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3 into)
      Sets the x,y,z of into to the x,y,z of the next item in the R3 sequence, and advances the sequence. Does not allocate. Modifies into in-place.
      Specified by:
      nextInto in class PointSequence<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3>
      Parameters:
      into - will be overwritten with new values, modified in-place
      Returns:
      into, after modifications
